arts.ttl: The lowdown on Millwall 1 Stoke City 0 - Ivanovic spot on in game lacking quality
arts.sum: Millwall recorded a fourth successive home win over Stoke City as Mihalio Ivanovic’s 93rd-minute penalty ensured they bounced back from their defeat against Championship promotion hopefuls Leeds United on Saturday lunchtime. Millwall: Jensen, Crama (Harding 74), Tanganga, Cooper, Bryan, Emakhu (Connolly 74), De Norre, Mitchell, Bangura-Williams (Cundle 90), Coburn, Ivanovic.

arts.ttl: Millwall boss Alex Neil on going with two strikers in today’s 1-0 victory over Stoke City
arts.sum: “We want to mix the game up—playing short when it’s on but also being able to turn it and carry a threat. He said: “I’m a bit conscious that we don’t want to play too short at home.

arts.ttl: Stoke City player ratings vs Millwall as two let Mark Robins down in loss
arts.sum: Stoke City suffered a heartbreaking late defeat at Millwall on Saturday as Mihailo Ivanovic scored a stoppage time penalty. Millwall goalkeeper Lukas Jensen then pulled off a brilliant save from close distance to deny Wouter Burger after the ball broke to the Dutchman inside the box.

arts.ttl: Millwall net late penalty to sink Stoke
arts.sum: Mihailo Ivanovic's stoppage-time penalty snatched a 1-0 victory for Millwall against Sky Bet Championship strugglers Stoke.

arts.ttl: Late drama as Millwall beat Stoke
arts.sum: Mihailo Ivanovic’s stoppage-time penalty gave the Lions the victory.

arts.ttl: Millwall vs Stoke City live news, action and reaction in Alex Neil reunion
arts.sum: Enda Stevens replaced Bocat in mid-week but then needed to be substituted himself as the game went into injury time. The good news is that Enda is not going to be out for any length of time.

arts.ttl: Stoke City told to 'keep driving forward' after kick up the backside
arts.sum: He said: “The game against Middlesbrough the other week was really disappointing, the goals we conceded were really disappointing, and that was the only game when you thought we hadn’t got anywhere near the level needed. Robins said: “I thought the game was really good the other night.

arts.ttl: Every player signed by Alex Neil as Stoke City deal with £18m transfer hangover
arts.sum: The Millwall game gives us a chance to look in hindsight at who arrived under Neil in 2023/24 - with help from then-technical director Ricky Martin and head of recruitment Jared Dublin - as Stoke's bean counters try to find a way to pay it off to satisfy FFP rules in 2025/26 without the Souttar money. “To be able to recruit a player of Enda’s calibre is a good start to our recruitment this summer and we look forward to seeing the positive influence he has on his teammates, both those already within our squad and those that follow him into the club in the coming weeks.”

arts.ttl: Mark Robins nailed it with one line about Bae Junho
arts.sum: So yes, you can pick and pick and pick, but the bottom line is credit to the players for their work rate on the fitness levels and with decision making as it is at this moment. We’re seeing glimpses of what Ali Al-Hamadi can offer but he can’t make the amount of runs he wants in the channels or work that nearest centre-back as much as he’d like just now after spending the best 12 months warming Ipswich’s bench.

arts.ttl: Mark Robins makes 'mediocrity' point as he plays Stoke City numbers game
arts.sum: “But because we’ve got players back that we need back – and we want everybody fit so things move quicker and there’s competition for places and people need to work really hard to get into the squad, never mind the team. “It’ll be a tough game but it’s the game prior to the international break – I think we’ve got six players called up – and trying to get to that and give everything we possibly can to get back-to-back wins because that’s really important.
